job_title: RN Charge Nurse in Chino, CA
pros: Working in a specialty like psych is very rewarding. Yes it’s challenging but thats what sets this place above the rest. Leadership is present, visible, and seeking to change things for the better. The teamwork here is exceptional and safety is everyone’s priority. Weekend differential are very generous! $9 on top of regular hourly rate.
cons: HR slow to respond Employer does not match 401k No EMR

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Chino, CA
pros: Clean environment Good work for starting out
cons: Managment doesn’t really care about your safety here how much work you put in moving up the ladder has to do with favoritism

job_title: RN Charge Nurse in Chino, CA
pros: Decent pay; will train but not much.
cons: Unorganized from top to bottom, dangerously understaffed.

review_title: High turnover and understaffed to save $
job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Chino, CA
pros: Promotes from within and if your favored you get more $

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Chino, CA
pros:
- I had great hard-working & compassionate co-workers (Family-like work environment) 
- Management & most employees were very nice & friendly
- Meals were very affordable compared to other hospitals
- Flexible work schedule
- CPR/CPI classes were conveniently provided in house
- 12 hour shifts
- 401k, medical/dental/vision insurance
cons:
- Fast-paced & at times a high-stress environment
- Working in mental health is rewarding, but undeniably mentally & emotionally draining
- Better staffing ratios 
- Admissions & discharges were spaced too closely together
- Paper charting

pros: No covid patients, no one is dying.
cons: Paper charting.Unsafe for working environment for staff due to patient aggression and understaffing.

review_title: Not the best but pays the bills...
job_title: Assessment and Referral Counselor in Chino, CA
pros:
Potiential for overtime esp when people call out last minute. 
Was able to get my license hours (had to get a Dr to sign off as the department head didnt want to).
cons:
Potiential to be sent home when its slow even if you want to work.
Getting in trouble for things "you should know" when you were never told about it before.
Poor management of in office drama. 
Potiential to be put in a tiny room with potientially violent people. I have heard of staff getting attacked while doing intakes. Yes they have a button you can push but its not like you are safe.
Not that good of pay 24-25/hr.. get your license and go somewhere that pays.

pros: I honestly can’t think of any Pro’s except for maybe free lunches and even at that the food wasn’t that great.
cons: High turnover rate, understaffed pretty much daily . Unsafe work environment. No support from upper management. The unit managers are poorly trained and really don’t know much more than the floor nurses. Overwhelming paperwork the amount of admissions and discharges are ridiculous . This hospital alway has complain ts and the state is always making visits.

job_title: Licensed Psychiatric Technician in Chino, CA
pros: Always opportunity for overtime. Good working conditions. Willing to work with your schedule needs most of the time.
cons: Understaffed more times than not. Favoritism takes place a lot of the time. Lack of support from Management.

job_title: Licensed Psychiatric Technician in Chino, CA
pros: You will learn the medication room well unless you want to lose your license.
cons: No safety, no type of alarms for staff. Staff do rounds alone and go into patients rooms alone with no safety such as alarms, whistles, screamers. Felt very unsafe the whole time and actually got injured. You will give IM injections all shift and it's usually used as the least restrictive measure they don't even try talking to the patient first. The pay is horrible and insulting especially if you have experience.

pros: Opportunity to help, with plenty of chances to fill in

review_title: Good Experince learning and carrying out duties, but.....
pros: Good experience for a new grad to work in a hospital setting
cons: NO upward mobility opportunities. management does not offer any incentives. Safety is horrible. Everyone is Per Diem, and hours are cut when you show up to work, so you dont get a full day.

cons: Low pay. In every department. No room to grow. Everybody blames everything on corporate. It's all about insurance. Extremely high turnover.
